title: AttributeError: module 'torch._C' has no attribute '_TensorBase'
body_html:
Hi all,
I have installed successfully Pytorch in a MacBookPro with an eGPU and everything is OK, however, when I try to install the Opencv package I have some problems that I can fix following the suggestion:
jrobchin/Computer-Vision-Basics-with-Python-Keras-and-OpenCV#1
In short, I have created a new environment and I have installed:

conda install openblas=0.2.19
conda install -c conda-forge opencv --override-channels
conda uninstall opencv
conda install -c https://conda.binstar.org/menpo opencv3

After that, I do not have problems with Opencv but with Pytorch. The erro is the following:

Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/Users/xxx/eclipse-workspace/unet/train.py", line 15, in
from common import *
File "/Users/xxx/eclipse-workspace/unet/common.py", line 27, in
import torch
File "/Users/xxx/anaconda3/envs/x1/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/init.py", line 184, in
from .tensor import Tensor
File "/Users/xxx/anaconda3/envs/x1/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 12, in
class Tensor(torch._C._TensorBase):
AttributeError: module 'torch._C' has no attribute '_TensorBase'

I do not have idea how to fix it. Can anybody help me?
Thanks,
Dani.

body:
Hi all,
I have installed successfully Pytorch in a MacBookPro with an eGPU and everything is OK, however, when I try to install the Opencv package I have some problems that I can fix following the suggestion:
https://github.com/jrobchin/Computer-Vision-Basics-with-Python-Keras-and-OpenCV/issues/1
In short, I have created a new environment and I have installed:
```
conda install openblas=0.2.19
conda install -c conda-forge opencv --override-channels
conda uninstall opencv
conda install -c https://conda.binstar.org/menpo opencv3
```
After that, I do not have problems with Opencv but with Pytorch. The erro is the following:

> Traceback (most recent call last):
>   File "/Users/xxx/eclipse-workspace/unet/train.py", line 15, in <module>
>     from common import *
>   File "/Users/xxx/eclipse-workspace/unet/common.py", line 27, in <module>
>     import torch
>   File "/Users/xxx/anaconda3/envs/x1/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/__init__.py", line 184, in <module>
>     from .tensor import Tensor
>   File "/Users/xxx/anaconda3/envs/x1/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/tensor.py", line 12, in <module>
>     class Tensor(torch._C._TensorBase):
> AttributeError: module 'torch._C' has no attribute '_TensorBase'

I do not have idea how to fix it. Can anybody help me?
Thanks,
Dani.
